DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Prostate-Specific Antigen Cancer Progression Outcome Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the lab value for prostate-specific antigen in the blood recorded at the time when progression or biochemical failure is reported.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Procedure Prostate-Specific Antigen Cancer Progression Outcome
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the results of the medical procedure that involves testing a sample of blood for prostate-specific antigen (a substance produced by the prostate that may be found in an increased amount in the blood of men who have prostate cancer, benign prostatic hyperplasia, or infection or inflammation of the prostate) following an increase in the size of a tumor or spread of cancer in the body.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A procedure for critical evaluation; a means of determining the presence, quality, or truth of something.

Concepts.definition: Any procedure that involves testing or manipulating a sample of blood, urine, or other body substance in a laboratory setting.

Property.preferredDefinition: Alternate isoforms of the single-chain 261-aa 30-kD Kallikrein 3 (Prostate Specific Antigen) glycoprotein precursor are encoded by human KLK3 Gene (Kallikrein Family). Frameshifted isoform 2 has a shorter distinct C-terminus. A serine protease in seminal plasma, PSA may function in liquefaction of seminal coagulum by (preferential Tyr-X) cleavage of seminal vesicle protein. Kallikrein proteases have diverse functions. Mounting evidence implicates kallikreins in carcinogenesis; some have potential as cancer biomarkers. The serum level of PSA is useful in diagnosis and monitoring of prostatic carcinoma. (from LocusLink, Swiss-Prot, OMIM, and NCI):The worsening of a cancer over time.:Outcome; a phenomenon that follows and is caused by some previous phenomenon.

Concepts.definition: Prostate-specific antigen (261 aa, ~29 kDa) is encoded by the human KLK3 gene. This protein plays a role in both proteolysis and seminal fluid liquefaction.
A pathologic process in which alterations at the molecular level result in a more aggressive cytologic and phenotypic profile and clinical course of a malignant neoplasm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: a PSA (prostate specific antigen) laboratory value.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Value; a numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ReferenceDocuments.name: 2-COMMENT
ReferenceDocuments.description: Units of measure shown on template form include: n/mg, ng/mL, U/L, mg/L, ng/dL, mcg/L
